TopicTitle: How have you abused the KSP aero model?

Articles.Content:
So recently among all the talk about the new aero model that is coming out in 1.0 I have also seen a bunch of people talking about how ludicrous the current model. We all knew that already and we al have probably seen or built some absurd things with this system. So before it is gone (except for the toggle switch) what are some of the most ridiculous things you have done with the system. I haven't done to many crazy things but to start this all off here is an aircraft I just built which is a little ridiculous:

I am also editing a video with it's construction and flight. So I will post that when I can.

Well, I don't have any pictures for it, but just about every infiniglider I've flown is an abuse of the aero model. As for blatant misuse... An aircraft I called the "Flying Box." Wing panels making a square wing, fuel tank in the middle, jet engine hiding inside the box, and one of those 2x2 Structural Panels slapped on the front.

Before the Trajectories mod was a thing, I pinpoint landed on Eve's tallest mountain by coming in straight down on it from interplanetary space. That's also how I to this day return to Kerbin from all interplanetary encounters. Just hit Kerbin and be happy.

I also had a pretty crazy ship launched for my Jool 5 mission, that I'd have hated to launch in FAR.

I don't have any pics but the start of this video is the launch:

Turning on infinite fuel and flying to Eve in the matter of hours. Then entering the atmosphere at 20 km/s

Aside from the typical wide-rocket-without-fairings thing that most stock aero players do, I made this for a challenge:

No infiniglide, the winglet stacks have all three control axes disabled.

Flies like a dream, landed on the first attempt:

Hmm, one thing that I and I'm sure others do currently that may no longer work in 1.0 is use wings sideways to eliminate their lift, that way they can be used for structure or decoration without effecting a crafts handling in unwanted ways.
I forcibly set all parts to have zero drag and zero lift, pummelling the standard aerodynamics into limp powerless submission, then I run a custom aerodynamics model instead

I changed the lift ratios of a few of the wings to make my space planes look nicer (and be able to take off in some cases) but as a result on some of the control surfaces allow me to glide smaller sized craft indefinitely.

Some things i habitually take advantage of due to my personal preference of aesthetics above 100% realism. Things like wings clipped inside fuselages, yes in real life this would NEVER work, but its the sole reason many of my sci-fi craft, such as my entire Tri-Fighter lineup, and my relatively successful fully SSTO capable Normandy replica, are even capable of moving and flying.

Jet engines are also something ive been abusing, since they are (regardless of the fact i could care less and like them as is) overpowered in too many ways. They eat way less fuel then any real life engine, they function at altitudes real engines would never work at, and most of all they (with enough intakes), can get you to absurd AP's above 200km alone with no rocket engines!

Finally, regardless of what others may think, i actually enjoy the game for what it is, i see nothing wrong with abusing these bugs (or features). It makes this game something unique compared to say another flight sim. I would love to see realistic looking craft fly realistically, but at the same time i would love for some of those crazy designs, sci-fi replicas, and absurd contraptions still be possible to make. I dont mind outright bugs like infiniglide or krakendrives gone, but i still think things like clipped wings functioning is essential to too many designs.

Back when I played without FAR I did all the typical stuff, launched huge space stations in one go sitting on top of a pancake, launched rovers straight up with a large flat bottom facing directly into the prograde vector, and of course I completely ignored any data concerning speed, periapsis, etc on interplanetary returns. I would come straight down on high elliptic returns from Jool or Eeloo just so I didn't have to spend any appreciable time in 4x timewarp or the drudgery that is a controlled descent.
